p: CoVs are common zoonotic pathogens. Studies have shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2, HCoV-NL63, and HCoV-229E may originate from bats, 44, 45 while HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 may have originated from rodents and bats 46, 47 ( Table 1). The high population density and widespread distribution of bats provide opportunities for pathogen infection and rapid transmission. When there is frequent contact between bats and humans, companion animals, and livestock, the possibility of cross-species transmission increases. Carnivorous bats may acquire other pathogens from insects or birds and may transmit viruses to predators that prey on bats. 48
